Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: and I believe as we ll handle it in the coming weeks very differently that the checksum part will even be invisible

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: only the validity "boolean" is needed on GUI

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: James solution about giving specific timestamp instead of block is cool, because it won't rely on any query

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: as timestamp can be generated on js with no harm

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: the only thing we ll need is some sort of data for integrated coins with activation timestamps

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: so, I decided last night to change how I handle sending, cause it currently requires some calls that are very slow, like executing a script on the coinserver to get status + executing remotely scripts that will generate every single bit of needed info to put the params in files to get it automatically processed independently by the coinserver

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
the limitation about this is pretty simple : 

Imagine we got a version very fast of the backend that runs, let s say we re on status 6 : All green, trade will happen,  On status 6 it will basically send the raw info to the specified and chosen coinserver to just give him the info about the TX we need to send

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Works for SRC -> status 7, and do the same for DST

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: and if sending the raw info for dst is ok : status 10 : begin sending

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: BUT

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: the thing is with this strategy, if we achieve to run scripts concurrently with minimal sleeptime... Things can get delayed, or a server / coin can crash

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: that mean we would for example stay stuck on status 7 : src has been sent to the server that will process it, but dst failed.

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: in that specific case, it s a problem

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: cause the coinserver won t care about the specific status of the trade, it will only process what we give and feed him

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: so I decided to replace the calls that create the files on Coinserver by a DB version

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: it will basically have the same information

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: but just with a minimal change of the query we can add requirements like : go if status=10

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: and make sure both side are completed at same time

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: cause it also could have broken things with current implementation

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: we could call this an edge case... but it can happen :

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: imagine a trade went good and only the DST raw sending fails

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: we re stuck at status 7, infos are already sent to coinserver, and he will process the TX

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: but what if any user seeing there is downtime asks for a cancellation

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: 1st user will have received his share

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: and other not, still on buffered address of opposite side

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: so a refund would just act as : One user got both funds

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: Obviously, that is not possible atm, already protected
